content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

user_context_message_data.about_model_message:
don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.

entries.title: Real-time Speech Translation in Google Meet: A Game-Changer for Global ...
entries.snippet: What is Real-time Speech Translation in Google Meet? Real-time Speech Translation in Google Meet is an AI-powered feature that translates spoken words into another language instantly during a video call. Picture this: you speak English, your teammate hears Spanishâ€”live, no delays.

entries.title: Video Call Translation - Live translate with Vidby
entries.snippet: Video call translation for Google Meet and Zoom Communicate with foreign language participants in Google Meet. Connect our Virtual Assistant for real-time voice translation into various target languages.

entries.title: Microsoft Teams will help you speak in a foreign language during meetings
entries.snippet:
Microsoft Teams is introducing a new real-time AI-powered interpreter feature in early 2025, allowing meeting participants to speak and listen in their preferred language. This tool uses speech-to-speech translation and can simulate a user's personal voice in another language. Initially supporting up to nine languages, this feature is part of broader AI enhancements within Teams. Additionally, multilingual transcription for up to 31 languages will be supported for meeting transcripts.

Other enhancements include AI-powered summaries of visual content from PowerPoint or the web shown during meetings, and the ability of Microsoft Copilot to summarize files shared in the Teams chat. Microsoft will also roll out a Teams Super Resolution feature for Copilot Plus PCs using local NPU chips to improve video call quality under weak internet conditions. Developers will gain access to image super resolution APIs, and updates to the Copilot Runtime will introduce functions such as image segmentation, object erase, and image description.

v.title: Microsoft is testing live translation on Intel and AMD Copilot Plus PCs
v.snippet: Microsoft has begun testing its live translation feature on Intel and AMD-based Copilot Plus PCs, expanding its availability beyond the initial rollout on Qualcomm-powered devices. The feature, currently accessible to Windows 11 Insiders in the Dev Channel, translates audio from over 44 languages into real-time English subtitles, working with any audio played on the deviceâ€”whether from online videos, live conferences, or recordings. Supported languages include Spanish, French, Chinese, Russian, Korean, Arabic, and more. In addition to this expansion, Microsoft is enhancing the service on Qualcomm PCs to support translations into Simplified Chinese. This development is part of Microsoftâ€™s broader effort to bring more AI-driven capabilities, such as the Recall feature for memory retrieval, to a wider range of hardware platforms.

v.title: Google Meet can translate what you say into other languages
v.snippet:
Google is introducing real-time speech translation in Google Meet, leveraging its Gemini AI technology. This new feature, revealed during Google's I/O event, allows spoken words to be translated into a conversation partner's preferred language while preserving the original speakerâ€™s voice, tone, and expression. Initially, translations are available only between English and Spanish, but Google plans to expand to Italian, German, and Portuguese soon.

The translation feature is rolling out in beta for users subscribed to the AI Pro plan or the premium AI Ultra subscription, which costs $249.99 per month. In a demonstration, Google showed how English and Spanish speakers can seamlessly communicate, with Meet providing real-time dubbed translations reflecting natural vocal inflections. This development places Google in competition with Microsoft Teams, which launched a similar AI translation feature earlier in the year.

entries.title: All Windows Users Can Now Translate Speech in Real Time
entries.snippet:
Microsoft has announced that its real-time speech translation technology is now available to all Skype users on Windows. This tool allows users to translate conversations almost instantly in seven supported languages: English, Chinese Mandarin, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, and Spanish. Text-to-text translation is also available in over 50 languages. The rollout comes after a gradual introduction that began in October and follows initial demonstrations in 2014. Users can activate the translator by clicking the globe icon in Skype, provided their app is up to date.

Since its launch, Skype Translator has seen significant growth, with call volume increasing by 400%. The most popular language pair to date has been French-to-English. Microsoft's translation services improve continuously through machine learning, which enables the software to enhance its performance over time based on past interactions, allowing more accurate and natural translations.
